name: Forward Guidance
title: Utf8b8juha A New Biz Cycle
text:
Synopsis
The U.S. economy appears to be entering a new business cycle, characterized by early signs of manufacturing recovery and potential economic expansion, despite previous uncertainties caused by the COVID-19 pandemic and aggressive monetary policies.

Key Insights
- Leading economic indicators suggest the manufacturing sector may be emerging from a prolonged downturn, with ISM manufacturing PMIs and new orders showing signs of breakout
- Commodities are beginning to break out after two years of consolidation, potentially signaling an upswing in economic growth
- Several U.S. states are exploring strategic Bitcoin reserves, including Texas and Oklahoma, proposing legislation to invest state funds in cryptocurrency
- The SEC has filed an appeal in its case against Ripple, continuing its legal challenge regarding XRP's status as a security
- U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs reported collective net inflows for the first time since January 7, indicating potential renewed investor interest
- eToro has filed for a U.S. initial public offering, with a potential NYSE listing valuing the company at approximately $5 billion
- The current economic environment suggests an early stage of a new business cycle, avoided a recession through significant fiscal stimulus and deficits
